kuusisto.tinysound.internal

Class MemSound

  • java.lang.Object
    • kuusisto.tinysound.internal.MemSound
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sound

    public class MemSound
extends Object
implements Sound
    The MemSound class is an implementation of the Sound interface that stores all audio data in memory for low latency.
    Author:
    Finn Kuusisto

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MemSound(byte[] left, byte[] right, Mixer mixer, int id)
      Construct a new MemSound with the given data and Mixer which will handle this MemSound.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void play()
      Plays this MemSound.
      void play(double volume)
      Plays this MemSound with a specified volume.
      void play(double volume, double pan)
      Plays this MemSound with a specified volume and pan.
      void stop()
      Stops this MemSound from playing.
      void unload()
      Unloads this MemSound from the system.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MemSound

        public MemSound(byte[] left,
        byte[] right,
        Mixer mixer,
        int id)
        Construct a new MemSound with the given data and Mixer which will handle this MemSound.
        Parameters:
        left - left channel of sound data
        right - right channel of sound data
        mixer - Mixer that will handle this MemSound
        id - unique ID of this MemSound

    • Method Detail

      • play

        public void play()
        Plays this MemSound.
        Specified by:
        play in interface Sound

      • play

        public void play(double volume)
        Plays this MemSound with a specified volume.
        Specified by:
        play in interface Sound
        Parameters:
        volume - the volume at which to play this MemSound

      • play

        public void play(double volume,
        double pan)
        Plays this MemSound with a specified volume and pan.
        Specified by:
        play in interface Sound
        Parameters:
        volume - the volume at which to play this MemSound
        pan - the pan value to play this MemSound [-1.0,1.0], values outside the valid range will assume no panning (0.0)

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops this MemSound from playing. Note that if this MemSound was played repeatedly in an overlapping fashion, all instances of this MemSound still playing will be stopped.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Sound

      • unload

        public void unload()
        Unloads this MemSound from the system. Attempts to use this MemSound after unloading will result in error.
        Specified by:
        unload in interface Sound
